tag_list: tahir-mohsan, time-computers, tiny-computers, evesham, telephone-systems, supanet, vmt
overview:
Tahir Mohsan is the founder of Time Computers, Supanet, Tpad Ltd, and currently manages several investment companies from his base in Dubai.

Time Computers was set up by Tahir Mohsan and his half-brother, Tariq Mohammed, in 1987 with an investment of just Â£1,000. At that time Mohsan was aged just 16.

Following its takeover of rival Tiny in 2002, the Â£207m-turnover UK operation (owned by Granville Technology) had a national chain of over 300 retail stores that traded under the Computer Shop brand.

Time Group continues in the UK, Middle East and the Far East, supplying computers, notebooks, plasma screens, telephone systems and TFT screens around the world.

Mohsan also owns the UK’s 5th largest Internet service provider Supanet, Currently under the control of Zuber Mohsan who is the companies managing director the Mohans family investment companies have interests in the IT and property industries across Europe, the Middle East and Asia. These range from hardware manufacturing and sales to Internet services, software development and Voice over IP technology company Tpad.

Tpad is an International company which has its Headquarters in Jersey, and provides products and services in many countries including the UAE, India, Hong Kong, USA, UK and Canada.

In the UK, Tpad provides advanced telephony services for businesses, the public sector and corporates. Until recently the core product has been large IP PBX based business telephone systems (50 users to 500+ users and multiple sites). Tpad also has an International consumer arm providing low cost International Services to all major countries.

He has acquired the Evesham Technology Group, currently the UK’s largest PC and flat-screen manufacturer
